title: Fort Smith National Historic Site: First Fort (1817-1824)
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Places     First Fort (1817-1824)                Places at the First Fort Smith (1817-1824)       The need to establish peace between the Osage and Cherokee led to the establishment of Fort Smith on the confluence of the Arkansas and Poteau Rivers.  Site chosen by Major Stephen H. Long of the Topographical Engineers Fort Smith was established on December 25, 1817 Commander was Major William Bradford Name after General Thomas Smith, Commander of U.S. Army Rifle Regiment Abandoned in 1824 Archeologists uncovered the foundations we see today in the late 1950s            Artist drawing of First Fort Smith         Foundation of the first Fort Smith FOSM
